1.text: Truth I say in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing testimony with me in the Holy Spirit,

2.text: that I have great grief and unceasing pain in my heart—

3.text: for I was wishing, I myself, to be anathema from the Christ—for my brethren, my kindred, according to the flesh,

4.text: who are Israelites, whose is the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the lawgiving, and the service, and the promises,

5.text: whose are the fathers, and of whom is the Christ, according to the flesh, who is over all, God blessed to the ages. Amen.

6.text: And it is not possible that the word of God hath failed; for not all who are of Israel are these Israel;

7.text: nor because they are seed of Abraham are all children, but—‘in Isaac shall a seed be called to thee;’

8.text: that is, the children of the flesh—these are not children of God; but the children of the promise are reckoned for seed;

9.text: for the word of promise is this; ‘According to this time I will come, and there shall be to Sarah a son.’

10.text: And not only so, but also Rebecca, having conceived by one—Isaac our father—

11.text: (for they being not yet born, neither having done anything good or evil, that the purpose of God, according to choice, might remain; not of works, but of Him who is calling,) it was said to her—

13.text: according as it hath been written, ‘Jacob I did love, and Esau I did hate.’

14.text: What, then, shall we say? unrighteousness is with God? let it not be!

15.text: for to Moses He saith, ‘I will do kindness to whom I do kindness, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion;’

16.text: so, then—not of him who is willing, nor of him who is running, but of God who is doing kindness:

17.text: for the Writing saith to Pharaoh—‘For this very thing I did raise thee up, that I might shew in thee My power, and that My name might be declared in all the land;’

18.text: so, then, to whom He willeth, He doth kindness, and to whom He willeth, He doth harden.

19.text: Thou wilt say, then, to me, ‘Why yet doth He find fault? for His counsel who hath resisted?’

20.text: nay, but, O man, who art thou that art answering again to God? shall the thing formed say to Him who did form it, Why me didst thou make thus?

21.text: hath not the potter authority over the clay, out of the same lump to make the one vessel to honour, and the one to dishonour?

22.text: And if God, willing to shew the wrath and to make known His power, did endure, in much long suffering, vessels of wrath fitted for destruction,

23.text: and that He might make known the riches of His glory on vessels of kindness, that He before prepared for glory, whom also He did call—us—

24.text: not only out of Jews, but also out of nations,

25.text: as also in Hosea He saith, ‘I will call what is not My people—My people; and her not beloved—Beloved,

26.text: and it shall be—in the place where it was said to them, Ye are not My people; there they shall be called sons of the living God.’

27.text: And Isaiah doth cry concerning Israel, ‘If the number of the sons of Israel may be as the sand of the sea, the remnant shall be saved;

28.text: for a matter He is finishing, and is cutting short in righteousness, because a matter cut short will the Lord do upon the land.

29.text: and according as Isaiah saith before, ‘Except the Lord of Sabaoth did leave to us a seed, as Sodom we had become, and as Gomorrah we had been made like.’

30.text: What, then, shall we say? that nations who are not pursuing righteousness did attain to righteousness, and righteousness that is of faith,

31.text: and Israel, pursuing a law of righteousness, at a law of righteousness did not arrive;

32.text: wherefore? because—not by faith, but as by works of law; for they did stumble at the stone of stumbling,

33.text: according as it hath been written, ‘Lo, I place in Sion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offence; and every one who is believing thereon shall not be ashamed.’
